> Tucson jumps to his feet quickly. The buzzing was familliar. He =
does what any Autobot would do to try and defend himself.. Reach for a weap=
on he was well adept at using. But it was not there. He had forgotten that =
Straight Shot is his weapon when she transforms into his cross bow. He quic=
kly remembers, and looks down at Vestige.
>
> " Rest in peace old friend. I=
t's all right, eventually I'll get my bearings."
>
> He bravely prepares to=
 defend himself via un armed combat skills.
>

ll be learning very fast."

As Tuscon leaped to his feet he can see that th=
e light of the day was
beginning to pass and night was setting in. In the d=
istance he could
see what appeared to be shadowy shapes in the air. They lo=
oked
different from the first set of insects that he had seen. These were
w=
inged, and it was their wings in flight that he heard as they
approached. A=
lso their bodies were longer, more like hornets, although
they had six clea=
ver like claws that looked sharp enough to slice
through anything.

There w=
ere three of them moving through the air, in the dimming light
Tuscon could=
 just see that their wings were a blue white, their bodies
were a darker bl=
ue. Their color scheme was startling close to
Scourge's colors, or perhaps =
one of his sweeps. Also Tuscon's radar
seemed to be unable to pick up these=
 creatures. He could see them just
fine, but his radar on which he was so u=
sed to depending was unable to
get a reading on them, and the insects were =
quickly approaching the
car, the buzzing of their wings becoming louder and=
 louder.

He could hear that same feminine voice, "We are the horde, and we=
 are
coming for you. You cannot escape, because there is no where to go."

=
Meanwhile the car itself was puling in towards some sort of depot,
although=
 with the growing shadows of the day it was difficult to see
inside far eno=
ugh to see whether there was any sort of welcoming party
there or not.

Nea=
rby Vestige moaned and stirred slightly. It would seem that he was
not dead=
 but had simply fell unconscious, the power requirements for
the remainder =
of his healing drawing off too much at once and shutting
down his systems.
